Preliminary data: 100 missing persons, 15 buried, 3 deceased according to information from the Hospital of San Marcos.
The main priority is the life of Guatemalan and Guatemalan people, and hospital care for the people affected.
The second priority is the help to the people affected and the recount of the damages in the country.
The third priority is to keep the vital lines clear so that relief and supplies can arrive.
#RecursosAvailable: 16 thousand cold rations, 34 centers with basic elements, distributed territorially.
#Resources available: Air Force 3 helicopters, and 6 more from the NAS, a helicopter for rescue operations.
2,045 elements of the army are available in San Marcos on the coast of Quetzaltenango and Retalhuleu area.
Red Population Alert is established in San Marcos, avoid concentration of people, cancel all activity of this type.
Civil Aeronautics ready to establish an airlift to evacuate people or transport resources to the affected areas.
154 people are housed in San Marcos, if the number increases, more shelters will be set up to meet the needs.
For today and tomorrow my agenda is suspended, to take care of completely the situation that the country is living.

Press Conference begins at the headquarters of @ConredGuatemala of the last damage count, live broadcast from http://t.co/bTzI8joh
52 people died, 22 disappeared, it is assumed that the number of deceased people is more but we will work on official data.
762 people remain in shelters and 5,251 is the data of victims.
The number of damaged homes is 2,263, this is a first data that can continue to grow.
People who drive on the affected roads are asked to refrain from doing so, even though they are restored, they remain unstable.
We have offers of help from the countries of Spain, USA. UU., Mexico, Honduras, Nicaragua, Costa Rica, Venezuela, Colombia.
44 tons of humanitarian aid were mobilized to Quetzaltenango and San Marcos, the logistics train for the affected places continues.
It was decreed "National Duel" for three days, before the situation in the country.
The state of calamity is decreed only for the departments of: San Marcos, Quetzaltenango, Quiché and Huehuetenango.
The most affected departments are focused, to begin with the reconstruction phase.
Electric power is restored by 95%, it is working to be able to have the electric power restored in the whole country today.
Humanitarian aid has established protocols with basic help. (Pure Water, Sponges, Hygiene Kit, Diapers, Food)
State of Calamity is decreed for 30 days, it is expected that in this period the highest percentage of damages can be resolved.
The subsidies to the affected people is important, so it will be an analysis phase through staff of the @ConredGuatemala.
I make a call to transporters and business owners so that prices are not speculated and the population is affected.
The affected and affected people have the support of all Guatemalans and all the support of the Government of Guatemala.
I will travel to the department of Quetzaltenango, to supervise the situation of the affected families, and to make a recount of damages.
In the afternoon it is planned to offer more information to the population about the situation of the country, with updated data.
Guatemalans and Guatemalans it is time that we unite and show solidarity with all the affected families. Force Guatemala!
